item.title: re-writing as.formula
item.description: The base r function as.formula is not very good. It can only handle very basic strings. For instance as.formula("money ~ brains + looks") # works ## money ~ brains + looks but as.formula("money ~ net-worth + tips") # doesn't work ## money ~ net - worth + tips because it can’t recognise that net-worth is a single word. Let’s pause a minute and think of when we might want to use as.
